name: Back to Top
description: Button component that allows users to quickly return to the top of the page, appearing when users have scrolled down and providing smooth navigation back to the beginning of content.

examples.name: Basic Back to Top
examples.description: Standard back to top button with default positioning

examples.name: Custom Back to Top
examples.description: Back to top button with custom classes

when_to_use: On long pages where users need to scroll significantly
In content-heavy pages like articles or documentation
When users frequently need to return to page navigation or header
For improving user experience on mobile devices with limited scrolling
In applications with infinite scroll or extensive content lists
when_not_to_use: On short pages that fit within a single viewport
In applications with persistent header navigation
When the page already has a sticky navigation element
For print media (component is hidden in print styles)
best_practices: Position the button in a consistent location (typically bottom-right)
Only show the button after users have scrolled a certain distance
Use appropriate visual styling that stands out but doesn't obstruct content
Ensure the button is accessible via keyboard navigation
Provide smooth scrolling animation for better user experience
Include visually hidden text for screen readers
Test positioning across different screen sizes

accessibility.notes: Component includes visually hidden text for screen readers and proper keyboard navigation support. Uses skip-to-target functionality for accessibility.

known_issues: Button appears in fixed position and may overlap with other floating elements
Scrollspy functionality requires JavaScript to be enabled
variations: Default: Fixed position button with scroll detection
Custom styled: Button with modified appearance via modifier classes
